verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> it came <S%G1096><s%> about that on a [certain] Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> He was passing <S%G1279><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> [some] grainfields; <S%G4702><s%> and His disciples <S%G3101><s%> were picking <S%G5089><s%> and eating <S%G2068><s%> the heads <S%G4719><s%> [of grain,] rubbing <S%G5597><s%> them in their hands. <S%G5495><s%>
But some <S%G5100><s%> of the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> "Why <S%G5101><s%> do you do <S%G4160><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> is not lawful <S%G1832><s%> on the Sabbath <S%G4521><s%>?"

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> answering <S%G611><s%> them said, <S%G3004><s%> "Have you not even <S%G3761><s%> read <S%G314><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> David <S%G7035><s%> did <S%G4160><s%> when <S%G3698><s%> he was hungry, <S%G3983><s%> he and those <S%G3588><s%> who were with him,

how <S%G5613><s%> he entered <S%G1525><s%> the house <S%G3624><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> and took <S%G2983><s%> and ate <S%G2068><s%> the consecrated <S%G4286><s%> bread <S%G740><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> is not lawful <S%G1832><s%> for any to eat <S%G2068><s%> except <S%G1508><s%> the priests <S%G2409><s%> alone, <S%G3441><s%> and gave <S%G1325><s%> it to his companions <S%G3588><s%> <S%G3326><s%>? "
And He was saying <S%G3004><s%> to them, "The Son <S%G5207><s%> of Man <S%G444><s%> is Lord <S%G2962><s%> of the Sabbath. <S%G4521><s%>"

And it came <S%G1096><s%> about on another <S%G2087><s%> Sabbath, <S%G4521><s%> that He entered <S%G1525><s%> the synagogue <S%G4864><s%> and was teaching; <S%G1321><s%> and there was a man <S%G444><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> whose <S%G2532><s%> <S%G846><s%> right <S%G1188><s%> hand <S%G5495><s%> was withered. <S%G3584><s%>

And the scribes <S%G1122><s%> and the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> were watching <S%G3906><s%> Him closely, <S%G3906><s%> [to see] if <S%G1487><s%> He healed <S%G2323><s%> on the Sabbath, <S%G4521><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> that they might find <S%G2147><s%> [reason] to accuse <S%G2723><s%> Him.

But He knew <S%G3609><s%> what <S%G1261><s%> they were thinking, <S%G1261><s%> and He said <S%G3004><s%> to the man <S%G435><s%> with the withered <S%G3584><s%> hand, <S%G5495><s%> "Rise <S%G1453><s%> and come <S%G2476><s%> forward <S%G1519><s%>! <S%G3319><s%>" And he rose <S%G450><s%> and came <S%G2476><s%> forward.

And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "I ask <S%G1905><s%> you, is it lawful <S%G1832><s%> on the Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> to do <S%G15><s%> good, <S%G15><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> to do <S%G2554><s%> harm, <S%G2554><s%> to save <S%G4982><s%> a life, <S%G5590><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> to destroy <S%G622><s%> it?"

And after looking <S%G4017><s%> around <S%G4017><s%> at them all, <S%G3956><s%> He said <S%G3004><s%> to him, "Stretch <S%G1614><s%> out your hand! <S%G5495><s%>" And he did <S%G4160><s%> [so;] and his hand <S%G5495><s%> was restored. <S%G600><s%>

But they themselves <S%G846><s%> were filled <S%G4092><s%> with rage, <S%G454><s%> and discussed <S%G1255><s%> together <S%G4314><s%> <S%G240><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> <S%G302><s%> they might do <S%G4160><s%> to Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

And it was at this <S%G3778><s%> time <S%G2250><s%> that He went <S%G1831><s%> off <S%G1831><s%> to the mountain <S%G3735><s%> to pray, <S%G4336><s%> and He spent <S%G1273><s%> the whole <S%G1273><s%> night <S%G1273><s%> in prayer <S%G4335><s%> to God. <S%G2316><s%>

And when <S%G3753><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> came, <S%G1096><s%> He called <S%G4377><s%> His disciples <S%G3101><s%> to Him; and chose <S%G1586><s%> twelve <S%G1427><s%> of them, whom <S%G3739><s%> He also <S%G2532><s%> named <S%G3687><s%> as apostles: <S%G652><s%>

Simon, <S%G4613><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> He also <S%G2532><s%> named <S%G3687><s%> Peter, <S%G4074><s%> and Andrew <S%G406><s%> his brother; <S%G80><s%> and James <S%G2385><s%> and John; <S%G2491><s%> and Philip <S%G5376><s%> and Bartholomew; <S%G918><s%>
and Matthew <S%G3102><s%> and Thomas; <S%G2381><s%> James <S%G2385><s%> [the son] of Alphaeus, <S%G256><s%> and Simon <S%G4613><s%> who was called <S%G2564><s%> the Zealot; <S%G2208><s%>
Judas <S%G2455><s%> [the son] of James, <S%G2385><s%> and Judas <S%G2455><s%> Iscariot, <S%G2469><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> became <S%G1096><s%> a traitor. <S%G4273><s%>

And He descended <S%G2597><s%> with them, and stood <S%G2476><s%> on a level <S%G3977><s%> place; <S%G5117><s%> and [there was] a great <S%G4183><s%> multitude <S%G3793><s%> of His disciples, <S%G3101><s%> and a great <S%G4183><s%> throng <S%G4128><s%> of people <S%G2992><s%> from all <S%G3956><s%> Judea <S%G2453><s%> and Jerusalem <S%G2419><s%> and the coastal <S%G3882><s%> region <S%G3882><s%> of Tyre <S%G5184><s%> and Sidon, <S%G4605><s%>

who <S%G3739><s%> had come <S%G2064><s%> to hear <S%G191><s%> Him, and to be healed <S%G2390><s%> of their diseases; <S%G3554><s%> and those <S%G3588><s%> who were troubled <S%G1776><s%> with unclean <S%G169><s%> spirits <S%G4151><s%> were being cured. <S%G2323><s%>

And all <S%G3956><s%> the multitude <S%G3793><s%> were trying <S%G2212><s%> to touch <S%G681><s%> Him, for power <S%G1411><s%> was coming <S%G1831><s%> from Him and healing <S%G2390><s%> [them] all. <S%G3956><s%>

And turning <S%G1869><s%> His gaze <S%G3788><s%> on His disciples, <S%G3101><s%> He [began] to say, <S%G3004><s%> " Blessed <S%G3107><s%> [are] you [who are] poor, <S%G4434><s%> for yours <S%G5212><s%> is the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

"Blessed <S%G3107><s%> [are] you who hunger <S%G3983><s%> now, <S%G3568><s%> for you shall be satisfied. <S%G5526><s%> Blessed <S%G3107><s%> [are] you who weep <S%G2799><s%> now, <S%G3568><s%> for you shall laugh. <S%G1070><s%>

"Blessed <S%G3107><s%> are you when <S%G3752><s%> men <S%G444><s%> hate <S%G3404><s%> you, and ostracize <S%G873><s%> you, and cast <S%G3679><s%> insults <S%G3679><s%> at you, and spurn <S%G1544><s%> your name <S%G3686><s%> as evil, <S%G4190><s%> for the sake <S%G1752><s%> of the Son <S%G5207><s%> of Man. <S%G444><s%>

"Be glad <S%G5463><s%> in that day, <S%G2250><s%> and leap <S%G4640><s%> [for joy,] for behold, <S%G2400><s%> your reward <S%G3408><s%> is great <S%G4183><s%> in heaven; <S%G3772><s%> for in the same <S%G846><s%> way <S%G2596><s%> their fathers <S%G3962><s%> used to treat <S%G4160><s%> the prophets. <S%G4396><s%>
"But woe <S%G3759><s%> to you who are rich, <S%G4145><s%> for you are receiving <S%G568><s%> your comfort <S%G3874><s%> in full. <S%G568><s%>

"Woe <S%G3759><s%> to you who are well-fed now, <S%G3568><s%> for you shall be hungry. <S%G3983><s%> Woe <S%G3759><s%> [to you] who laugh <S%G1070><s%> now, <S%G3568><s%> for you shall mourn <S%G3996><s%> and weep. <S%G2799><s%>

"Woe <S%G3759><s%> [to you] when <S%G3752><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G444><s%> speak <S%G3004><s%> well <S%G2573><s%> of you, for in the same <S%G846><s%> way <S%G2596><s%> their fathers <S%G3962><s%> used to treat <S%G4160><s%> the false <S%G5578><s%> prophets. <S%G5578><s%>
"But I say <S%G3004><s%> to you who hear, <S%G191><s%> love <S%G25><s%> your enemies, <S%G2190><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> good <S%G2573><s%> to those <S%G3588><s%> who hate <S%G3404><s%> you,
bless <S%G2127><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who curse <S%G2672><s%> you, pray <S%G4336><s%> for those <S%G3588><s%> who mistreat <S%G1908><s%> you.

"Whoever hits <S%G5180><s%> you on the cheek, <S%G4600><s%> offer <S%G3930><s%> him the other <S%G243><s%> also; <S%G2532><s%> and whoever takes <S%G142><s%> away <S%G142><s%> your coat, <S%G2440><s%> do not withhold <S%G2967><s%> your shirt <S%G5509><s%> from him either. <S%G2532><s%>

"Give <S%G1325><s%> to everyone <S%G3956><s%> who asks <S%G154><s%> of you, and whoever takes <S%G142><s%> away <S%G142><s%> what <S%G3588><s%> is yours, <S%G4674><s%> do not demand <S%G523><s%> it back. <S%G523><s%>
"And just <S%G2531><s%> as you want <S%G2309><s%> people <S%G444><s%> to treat <S%G4160><s%> you, treat <S%G4160><s%> them in the same <S%G3668><s%> way. <S%G3668><s%>

"And if <S%G1487><s%> you love <S%G25><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who love <S%G25><s%> you, what <S%G4169><s%> credit <S%G5485><s%> is [that] to you? For even <S%G2532><s%> sinners <S%G268><s%> love <S%G25><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who love <S%G25><s%> them.

"And if <S%G1437><s%> you do <S%G15><s%> good <S%G15><s%> to those <S%G3588><s%> who do <S%G15><s%> good <S%G15><s%> to you, what <S%G4169><s%> credit <S%G5485><s%> is [that] to you? For even <S%G2532><s%> sinners <S%G268><s%> do <S%G4160><s%> the same. <S%G846><s%>

"And if <S%G1437><s%> you lend <S%G1155><s%> to those from whom <S%G3739><s%> you expect <S%G1679><s%> to receive, <S%G2983><s%> what <S%G4169><s%> credit <S%G5485><s%> is [that] to you? Even <S%G2532><s%> sinners <S%G268><s%> lend <S%G1155><s%> to sinners, <S%G268><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> to receive <S%G618><s%> back <S%G618><s%> the same <S%G2470><s%> [amount.]

"But love <S%G25><s%> your enemies, <S%G2190><s%> and do <S%G15><s%> good, <S%G15><s%> and lend, <S%G1155><s%> expecting <S%G560><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> in return; <S%G560><s%> and your reward <S%G3408><s%> will be great, <S%G4183><s%> and you will be sons <S%G5207><s%> of the Most <S%G5310><s%> High; <S%G5310><s%> for He Himself <S%G846><s%> is kind <S%G5543><s%> to ungrateful <S%G884><s%> and evil <S%G4190><s%> [men.]
"Be merciful, <S%G3629><s%> just <S%G2531><s%> as your Father <S%G3962><s%> is merciful. <S%G3629><s%>

"And do not judge <S%G2919><s%> and you will not be judged; <S%G2919><s%> and do not condemn, <S%G2613><s%> and you will not be condemned; <S%G2613><s%> pardon, <S%G630><s%> and you will be pardoned. <S%G630><s%>

"Give, <S%G1325><s%> and it will be given <S%G1325><s%> to you; good <S%G2570><s%> measure, <S%G3358><s%> pressed <S%G4085><s%> down, <S%G4085><s%> shaken <S%G4531><s%> together, <S%G4531><s%> running <S%G5240><s%> over, <S%G5240><s%> they will pour <S%G1325><s%> into your lap. <S%G2859><s%> For by your standard <S%G3358><s%> of measure <S%G3354><s%> it will be measured <S%G488><s%> to you in return. <S%G488><s%>"

And He also <S%G2532><s%> spoke <S%G3004><s%> a parable <S%G3850><s%> to them: "A blind <S%G5185><s%> man <S%G5185><s%> cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3385><s%> guide <S%G3594><s%> a blind <S%G5185><s%> man, <S%G5185><s%> can he? Will they not both <S%G297><s%> fall <S%G1706><s%> into a pit <S%G999><s%>?

"A pupil <S%G3101><s%> is not above <S%G5228><s%> his teacher; <S%G1320><s%> but everyone, <S%G3956><s%> after he has been fully <S%G2675><s%> trained, <S%G2675><s%> will be like <S%G5613><s%> his teacher. <S%G1320><s%>

"And why <S%G5101><s%> do you look <S%G991><s%> at the speck <S%G2595><s%> that is in your brother's eye, <S%G3788><s%> but do not notice <S%G2657><s%> the log <S%G1385><s%> that is in your own <S%G2398><s%> eye <S%G3788><s%>?

"Or how <S%G4459><s%> can <S%G1410><s%> you say <S%G3004><s%> to your brother, <S%G80><s%> 'Brother, <S%G80><s%> let <S%G863><s%> me take <S%G1544><s%> out the speck <S%G2595><s%> that is in your eye, <S%G3788><s%>' when you yourself <S%G846><s%> do not see <S%G991><s%> the log <S%G1385><s%> that is in your own eye <S%G3788><s%>? You hypocrite, <S%G5273><s%> first <S%G4413><s%> take <S%G1544><s%> the log <S%G1385><s%> out of your own eye, <S%G3788><s%> and then <S%G5119><s%> you will see <S%G1227><s%> clearly <S%G1227><s%> to take <S%G1544><s%> out the speck <S%G2595><s%> that is in your brother's eye. <S%G3788><s%>

"For there is no <S%G3756><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> tree <S%G1186><s%> which produces <S%G4160><s%> bad <S%G4550><s%> fruit; <S%G2590><s%> nor, <S%G3761><s%> on the other <S%G3825><s%> hand, <S%G3825><s%> a bad <S%G4550><s%> tree <S%G1186><s%> which produces <S%G4160><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> fruit. <S%G2590><s%>

"For each <S%G1538><s%> tree <S%G1186><s%> is known <S%G1097><s%> by its own <S%G2398><s%> fruit. <S%G2590><s%> For men do not gather <S%G4816><s%> figs <S%G4810><s%> from thorns, <S%G173><s%> nor <S%G3761><s%> do they pick <S%G5166><s%> grapes <S%G4718><s%> from a briar <S%G942><s%> bush. <S%G942><s%>

"The good <S%G18><s%> man <S%G444><s%> out of the good <S%G18><s%> treasure <S%G2344><s%> of his heart <S%G2588><s%> brings <S%G4393><s%> forth <S%G4393><s%> what <S%G18><s%> is good; <S%G18><s%> and the evil <S%G4190><s%> [man] out of the evil <S%G4190><s%> [treasure] brings <S%G4393><s%> forth <S%G4393><s%> what <S%G4190><s%> is evil; <S%G4190><s%> for his mouth <S%G4750><s%> speaks <S%G2980><s%> from that which <S%G4051><s%> fills <S%G4051><s%> his heart. <S%G2588><s%>
"And why <S%G5101><s%> do you call <S%G2564><s%> Me, 'Lord, <S%G2962><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%>' and do not do <S%G4160><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%>?

"Everyone <S%G3956><s%> who comes <S%G2064><s%> to Me, and hears <S%G191><s%> My words, <S%G3056><s%> and acts <S%G4160><s%> upon them, I will show <S%G5263><s%> you whom <S%G5101><s%> he is like: <S%G3664><s%>

he is like <S%G3664><s%> a man <S%G444><s%> building <S%G3618><s%> a house, <S%G3614><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> dug <S%G4626><s%> deep <S%G900><s%> and laid <S%G5087><s%> a foundation <S%G2310><s%> upon the rock; <S%G4073><s%> and when a flood <S%G4132><s%> rose, <S%G1096><s%> the torrent <S%G4215><s%> burst <S%G4366><s%> against <S%G4366><s%> that house <S%G3614><s%> and could <S%G2480><s%> not shake <S%G4531><s%> it, because <S%G1223><s%> it had been well <S%G2573><s%> built. <S%G3618><s%>

"But the one who has heard, <S%G191><s%> and has not acted <S%G4160><s%> [accordingly,] is like <S%G3664><s%> a man <S%G444><s%> who built <S%G3618><s%> a house <S%G3614><s%> upon the ground <S%G1093><s%> without <S%G5565><s%> any foundation; <S%G2310><s%> and the torrent <S%G4215><s%> burst <S%G4366><s%> against <S%G4366><s%> it and immediately <S%G2117><s%> it collapsed, <S%G4844><s%> and the ruin <S%G4485><s%> of that house <S%G3614><s%> was great. <S%G3173><s%>"
